children.text: There has not been sufficient fall of 1:100 provided to the balcony floor, which has resulted in water ponding, and will likely result in water leaking.
Part 3.8.1.3 - External above ground membranes of the NCC’s Building Code of Australia requires that
‘Waterproofing membranes for external above ground use must comply with AS 4654.1 and AS 4654.2’
, and the relevant Australian Standard AS 4654.2 Waterproofing membranes for external above-ground use in Clause 2.5.2 - Falls states that
‘Falls for surface drainage should be no flatter than 1:100’
‘Water shall not be retained on the finished surface’ .
Additionally, the Victorian Building Authority’s Guide to Standards and Tolerances clause 13.07 Ponding on waterproof decks and balconies, states
‘Waterproof decks and balconies are defective if water ponds or does not drain to the outer edge’
‘Decks and balconies that are required to be waterproofed are defective if they are not provided with adequate drainage and provision for overflow’ .
The floor of this balcony will need to be re-constructed to have minimum 1:100 fall, and then be properly waterproofed in accordance with the BCA and AS 4654.
